history.narrative: Law 9-266, the “Handgun Possession Amendment Act of 1992,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 9-91 which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 2, 1992, and July 7, 1972, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 21, 1992, it was assigned Act No. 9-247 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 9-266 became effective on May 7, 1993.
